method.name: enumerateDevices
method.tp:docstring: Retreive a printable list of all the video capture devices that are available.

arg.name: list
arg.tp:docstring: The list of all the video capture devices that are available.

method.name: getResolutionForDevice
method.tp:docstring: Find out what resolutions are supported for this device.

method.name: startLocalCapture
method.tp:docstring: Start capturing frames from a specified video device and write to shared memory.

arg.name: device
arg.tp:docstring: The video device to start capturing from.

arg.name: path
arg.tp:docstring: A path to the shared memory segment.

method.name: getEventFdPasserNamespace
method.tp:docstring: Retreive the namespace of a running instance of a file descriptor passer in the UNIX domain. This so-called file descriptor passer is only used for passing the fd corresponding to an eventfd() source. It would be possible with DBUS alone, but only starting from 1.3.

arg.name: device
arg.tp:docstring: The device of interest for event notifications (frame capture).

arg.name: path
arg.tp:docstring: The namespace of a running instance of a file descriptor passer for the corresponding device.

signal.name: frameAttributesChanged
signal.tp:docstring: Unused. This signal is being sent when one or multiple frame attributes have changed.

arg.name: segment
arg.tp:docstring: A path to the shared memory segment.

signal.name: videoStarted
signal.tp:docstring: Unused. This signal is being sent when video capture has started and client can therefore expect to be able to read frames.

arg.name: segment
arg.tp:docstring: A path to the shared memory segment in which this event occurred.

signal.name: videoStopped
signal.tp:docstring: Unused. This signal is being sent when video capture has stopped and client can therefore expect to be able to read frames.

arg.name: segment
arg.tp:docstring: A path to the shared memory segment in which this event occurred.
